title: Don't flaunt your body and avoid threatening men? With advice like this, no wonder women aren't equal at work
text:
A confession: right now, I do not have good hair. My nails aren’t manicured, nor am I wearing well-cut clothes that complement my body type.

This week, I spoke in a meeting without raising my hand or waiting my turn. What’s more, I addressed a male colleague face-to-face, without even stopping to think whether he might find it threatening.

What a monster. I’ll collect my P45 on the way out, shall I?

All this and more was the ludicrous advice given to women on a training course at Ernst & Young last year, which a former executive at the firm has blown the whistle on this week.

The global accounting firm hired an external consultant to teach 30 female executives – all seeking, believe it or...
